title: Example Usage​
content: local SimpleFlare = require(path.to.SimpleFlare) local att = Instance.new("Attachment") att.WorldOrientation = Vector3.new(0, 0, 0) att.WorldPosition = Vector3.new(0, 10, 20) att.Parent = workspace.Terrain local newFlare = SimpleFlare.new(att, nil, UDim2.new(10, 0, 10, 0)) print(newFlare.Dispose) -- false newFlare:Destroy() print(newFlare.Dispose) -- true Copy

title: Testing Instructions​
content: Put src/init.lua in ReplicatedStoragePut tests/ExampleFlare.lua in ReplicatedStoragePut tests/SimpleFlareTester.client.lua in StarterPlayerScripts It should look like this:  After that just hit Play and see it in action. Note that the attachment is in 0, 10, 20 of workspace.

title: Dispose​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> SimpleFlare.Dispose: boolean A boolean that determines if the SimpleFlare object will be destroyed in the next renderstep frame.

title: Instance​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> SimpleFlare.Instance: BillboardGui  The BillboardGui that the SimpleFlare object renders.

title: OriginalSize​
content: </> SimpleFlare.OriginalSize: UDim2  The base size of the flare that was passed in the originalSize argument of the SimpleFlare constuctor. You can set this property to anything you like.

title: new​
content: </> SimpleFlare.new( adornee: Part | Attachment ,-- The adornee of the flare flareImageId: string,-- The imageId of the flare originalSize: UDim2 -- The base size of the flare ) → SimpleFlare Creates a SimpleFlare object.

title: Destroy​
content: </> SimpleFlare:Destroy() → void Schedules the SimpleFlare to be destroyed in the next renderstep frame.
